title: B.2 Relations
content:
Section B.2

Relations

Summary

Binary relations and their properties.

Key Points

  • Relation R ⊆ A × A on set A
  • Reflexive: aRa for all a
  • Symmetric: aRb ⟹ bRa
  • Transitive: aRb and bRc ⟹ aRc
  • Equivalence relation: reflexive + symmetric + transitive

Example

≤ on integers: reflexive (a ≤ a), transitive, but not symmetric. Equivalence: = (equality).

Why It Matters

Partial orders, equivalence classes used in algorithm proofs.
